DAILY

) The Daily Transaction Register (DTR) is a listing of transactions which newly appended to IDRS modules with open TDA’s or TDI’s. The register Code printed in the Service Center after each daily or weekly update of IDRS. a. DTR’s distributed (or displayed with CC DAILY) on Monday, contain selected transactions which appended to IDRS on the previous b. DTR’s distributed (or displayed with CC DAILY) on Tuesday, contain selected transactions which appended to IDRS on the previous day posted transactions from the weekend update. c. DTR’s distributed (or displayed with CC DAILY) on Wednesday, Friday contain selected transactions which appended to IDRS on the previous day. (

) The DTR data for a particular area office is also available on IDRS located in that office. The display is available on the day following the weekly update in which the transactions appended or posted. (
) The Assistant Regional Commissioner Collection will designate those sites which will use CC DAILY and will issue guidelines for Command use. (

) Use CC DAILY to request a display of information from the current Daily action Register (DTR) for the area office of the terminal on which CC DAILY input. This Command Code is for Field Office use only. (

) Transaction Selection Criteria a. For TDI, only certain transactions are selected for the DTR: those update name and/or address or which recall a tax period or the entire b. For TDA, all transactions are selected for tax modules which were in status at the end of the last weekend TDA analysis with the following ceptions:

a. DTR’s distributed (or displayed with CC DAILY) on Monday, contain selected transactions which appended to IDRS on the previous Friday. b. DTR’s distributed (or displayed with CC DAILY) on Tuesday, contain selected transactions which appended to IDRS on the previous day plus posted transactions from the weekend update. c. DTR’s distributed (or displayed with CC DAILY) on Wednesday, through Friday contain selected transactions which appended to IDRS on the previous day.

For TDI, only certain transactions are selected for the DTR: those which update name and/or address or which recall a tax period or the entire TDI. For TDA, all transactions are selected for tax modules which were in TDA status at the end of the last weekend TDA analysis with the following ex-
b. Any TC
for zero (.
) amount c. Transactions with Document Code
or
processed through local Service Center pipeline (DDES). (

) A transaction selected for the DTR while in pending status will be reissued the DTR if the pending status code is updated to a deleted pending status of DQ, DU, DP or DN as a result of corrective action. (

) Assessment transactions for IMF, BMF, EPMF and IRAF TDA modules will be selected for the DTR until they have posted to their respective master and received the generated assessment date. These include tax penalty and interest assessments.

Assessment transactions for IMF, BMF, EPMF and IRAF TDA modules will not be selected for the DTR until they have posted to their respective master files and received the generated assessment date. These include tax penalty and interest assessments.

Line Position Description and Validity 1 1–5 COMMAND CODE “DAILY” 1 7–10 GROUP DESIGNATION (See below)

through
, to request the DTR information applicable to specific employee. b. Enter the fifth and sixth digits of the TDA/TDI Employee Assignment Number in screen positions
and

blank, to request DTR information applicable to a specific office group.
NO TRANSACTIONS—There are no transactions in the Daily Transaction Register Record match the input Group Designation.
GROUP DESIGNATION INVALID—The input Group Designation is not in one of the formats specified in (
) above. Correct and reinput.
DTRF NOT AVAILABLE—The Daily Transaction Register File has not been loaded into IDRS.
BOOK LIMIT REACHED/ALL TRANS NOT SHOWN—The terminal will display no more than pages. If the number of pages of data for the input Group Designation exceeds
, this will appear on line
of page
This message applies to system maximum capacity far exceeding maximum pages that will be available under guidelines for the use of this code. Notify Resident Program Analyst of the problem.

PF TOO BIG BREAK INTO MULT PF IF POS.—(Page File too big. Break into Multiple page possible.) This message applies to maximum system capacity far exceeding maximum pages will be allowed. Notify Resident Program Analyst of the problem.
INVALID DEFINER—The character following DAILY (sixth position) is not blank on the input screen.
For other error messages see Standard Validity Criteria IRM

b. Valid Response: The valid response is a display of information from the current Daily Transaction Register. The format for the response depends on whether the input Group Designation is for a Employee (see (
)(a) above) or for a specific Group (see (
)(a) above) or for an entire Area Office (
)(a) above).

Valid Response: The valid response is a display of information from the current Daily Transaction Register. The format for the response depends on whether the input Group Designation is for a Employee (see (2)(a) above) or for a specific Group (see (2)(a) above) or for an entire Area Office (see (2)(a) above).
Exhibit 2.3.30-2 (01-01-2007) Command Code DAILY Output Display
Valid Response for input Group Designations

a. The terminal displays transactions appended to modules having TDA/TDI Assignment Numbers match the input Group Designation. Within any Group Designation transactions are in order of the TDA/TDI Assignment Number. Thus, if the input Group Designation is all blanks (a blank matches number in the last four digits of the eight digit TDA/TDI Assignment Number) transactions for the Groups with “
” or “

n” (n= any numeric) in the fifth and sixth positions of the TDA/TDI Number will precede those for Field Groups. The Group Designation displayed on line one of the screen will show the last four digits of the TDA/TDI Assignment Number and will change as tions are displayed for sub-groups or individual employees within a group. A new page begins whenever the TDA/TDI Assignment Number changes. b. Transactions are displayed in the following order: By TDA/TDI Assignment Number Within TDA/TDI Assignment Number by Type of Case (TDA before (TDI) Within Type of Case by File (MF before all others) Within File by Cycle of Issuance Within Cycle of Issuance by Name Control Within Name Control by TIN Within TIN by Transaction Type (Entity transactions before Tax transactions)

For Group Designations with other than “800” or “8n” (n=any numeric) in the fifth and sixth positions of the TDA/ TDI Assignment Number there is no sort by Cycle of Issuance; Cycle of Issuance is present only for Office Branch assignments.

c. Line 24 is reserved for paging information. To expedite printing the end-of-line symbol is automatically displayed in the first position of every blank line and after the last character of every partially filled line.

Description
PENDING TRANSACTION IDENTIFICATION CODE. Three blanks identify a posted transaction.
NEW NAME LINE up to 4 lines will be displayed if necessary
Literals will be printed only if significant data is present.
